item.description:
Please come on out everyone!! And we can surely do some improv afterwards in this awesome room at Lesley as well!  More Details:
The piece is about one hour 15 minutes long with a 10 minute intermission.
 You're encouraged to play along and interact when called to throughout the piece
There will be a talk back after the show
Here is an interactive map to direct you to the venue:

Breaking the fourth wall, it addresses the audience as travelers, “where are you going?” but most crucially, “where are WE going,?” challenging the audience to focus upon making decisions that affect one another from a holistic stand-point.   A period of time away from my cell phone and constant influx of media, I learned a lot about my own disconnection to myself and discovered my strong material, media, and technology attachments.
As I faced intense fears in anticipation of graduation, I found clarity when I decided to spend time on a permaculture farm re-connecting with myself and nature, completely immersed in a different culture.  I hope my life changing story will help others through the big and over-whelming journey of, “what’s next?”… 


Seed of Spirit GenY
An Interactive Theater Piece
written and performed by Caitlin Green
Direction by Jason Jedrusiak
  

Peformance February 10th, 7:30pm 
Stebbins Hall RM 0302
Lesley University
31 Everett Street, Cambridge, MA
 
for those excited to offer greatly appreciated feedback with these questions in mind:.....
 
>what is the strongest message I take back from seeing this piece?
>Does the piece speak to high school and college students?
>Where are 3 places I can imagine this piece performed within the next year?
>How might I be willing to offer help in taking the piece to high schools, universities, and other venues?
  
  

http://www.lesley.edu/campus/campus-map.html
item.how_to_find_us: Look for signs, check out the map below! Walk up the stairs!
item.why: Hi Incuators! Come see Seed of Spirit: GenY @ Lesley 2morrow night! Caitlin & I put a lot of work into it as part of her thesis. An interactive theater performance based on her travels & graduating from college, it's truly unique & admission is free!
item.name: Show Tomorrow @ Lesley! Starring Incubator's own Caitlin Green & directed by me!
